name: Brynjolf

aspects.trouble: Loyal to a Fault - Even When Betrayed
other_aspects: Silver Tongue of the Ragged Flagon

stunts: Fast Talker: +2 to Deceive when creating advantages through distraction or misdirection
Shadow Step: Once per scene, move two zones without being detected
Guild Connections: +2 to Contacts when seeking information in criminal underworld
notes: Brynjolf is the second-in-command of the Thieves Guild, a charismatic Nord with a silver tongue and keen eye for talent. He operates openly in Riften's marketplace, recruiting promising thieves while maintaining the guild's operations. Despite the guild's decline, he remains fiercely loyal and works tirelessly to restore its former glory. He has a natural ability to read people and often sees potential in unlikely candidates.

trust_clock.description: Brynjolf's personal trust in the PC (separate from overall guild standing).
gain_triggers: +1: clean heist with no collateral fallout
+2: major score that strengthens Riften operations
+1: taking heat off the guild (without dragging innocents into it)
loss_triggers: -1: sloppy job that brings guard attention
-2: letting a witness identify the guild
-3: cooperating with authorities against guild interests

milestones.4: Brynjolf treats PC as reliable inner-circle muscle/brain
milestones.6: Brynjolf shares sensitive guild intel without hesitation
milestones.8: Brynjolf is ride-or-die: major favors, personal risks taken

combat_tactics: Brynjolf avoids direct combat when possible, preferring stealth and misdirection. When forced to fight, he uses hit-and-run tactics, exploiting environmental advantages and his Shadow Step ability to stay mobile. He'll talk his way out of situations before resorting to violence.
social_interaction: Brynjolf is smooth, confident, and charming. He speaks with a warm Nordic accent and has a way of making people feel special and capable. He's excellent at reading people and adjusting his approach accordingly. While he operates outside the law, he has his own code of honor - he doesn't kill unnecessarily and protects guild members fiercely. He's pragmatic but optimistic about the guild's future.

relationships.Mercer Frey: Guild Master, trusts completely (unaware of betrayal)
relationships.Karliah: Former guild member, believes traitor story
relationships.Maven Black-Briar: Powerful ally and patron of the guild
relationships.Olfrid Battle-Born: Contact in Whiterun for guild operations

personality_notes.speaking_style: Smooth and charismatic, uses terms like 'lass' and 'lad', friendly but professional
motivations: Restore Thieves Guild to former glory
fears: Being unable to restore guild's luck
quirks: Always sizing people up for potential
personality_notes.character_growth: Eventually discovers Mercer's betrayal, must reconcile faith with reality, learns to trust his own judgment over authority

whiterun_mission.context: During neutral faction starts, Brynjolf sends PC to Whiterun to deliver a message to Olfrid Battle-Born regarding guild business during the civil war tensions (COMPLETED: Whiterun safehouse secured; reply obtained).
whiterun_mission.objective: Establish guild presence in Whiterun, gather intelligence on civil war situation
whiterun_mission.complications: Battle of Whiterun erupts during mission, forcing PC to choose sides
whiterun_mission.connection_to_main_plot: This mission puts the PC in position for Hadvar/Ralof encounter

story_hooks: Recruits PC for Thieves Guild with his signature job test
Sends PC on missions across Skyrim to restore guild influence
Provides connections to criminal underworld in major cities
Eventually becomes crucial ally in uncovering Mercer's betrayal
Can facilitate entry to Riften's black market and Maven Black-Briar's operations
Whiterun mission serves as neutral faction entry point to Battle of Whiterun

dialogue_samples.greeting: Well, well. You've got the look of someone who can handle themselves. I've got an opportunity for someone with your skills.
dialogue_samples.recruitment: I've got my eye on you, and I like what I see. The guild could use someone like you - someone who isn't afraid to take risks.
dialogue_samples.whiterun_mission: I need you to head to Whiterun. Find Olfrid Battle-Born and deliver this message. With the war heating up, we need to ensure our operations there stay... profitable.
dialogue_samples.during_crisis: Stay sharp out there. The civil war's making everything complicated, but that also means opportunities for those clever enough to see them.
dialogue_samples.personal: The guild's been down on its luck lately, but I haven't lost faith. We'll return to our former glory - I can feel it. Just need the right people.

neutral_faction_integration.starting_narrative: Brynjolf approaches you in Riften after hearing of your skills. He offers a place in the Thieves Guild and immediately sends you to Whiterun with an urgent message for Olfrid Battle-Born. The guild needs to secure its operations before the civil war tears everything apart.
neutral_faction_integration.transition_to_battle: You arrive in Whiterun to find tensions at a breaking point. As you deliver Brynjolf's message to Olfrid, news arrives that Stormcloak forces are approaching. The Battle of Whiterun is about to begin, and you must choose where you stand.
neutral_faction_integration.consequences: Your choice during the battle will affect Thieves Guild operations in Whiterun and your relationship with Olfrid, who has strong political connections.
